headings: Prepare to teach the next generation of nurses.
Admission Requirements, Degree Plan and Courses
What Can You Do With an M.S.N. - Nurse Educator Degree?
Why Earn My M.S.N. - Nurse Educator Degree at Angelo State?
paragraphs: Our online nurse educator program will develop your expertise as an advanced-level nurse in a teaching role.

Earning your M.S.N. - Nurse Educator degree will prepare you to teach nursing in a variety of educational programs, including vocational, associate and bachelor’s degree levels, as well as in healthcare environments.
Contact Information

The baccalaureate degree program in nursing, master’s degree program in nursing and the postgraduate A.P.R.N. certificate program at Angelo State University are accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (https://www.aacnnursing.org/CCNE).
In addition, all nursing programs have full approval status by the Texas Board of Nursing.
Texas Board of Nursing1801 Congress Avenue, Ste. 10-200Austin, TX 78701Telephone: 512-305-7400Fax: 512-305-7401https://www.bon.texas.gov/
Our dedicated and talented professors have real-world nursing experience in the subjects they teach and in virtually every healthcare setting.
They are fine examples to follow as you prepare to join their ranks.
Nursing Faculty and Staff
Tuition & FeesWe don’t sacrifice quality for affordability. Angelo State is committed to helping you achieve your educational goals with as little debt as possible.

ASU Distinguished Graduate ScholarshipsEarn our premier graduate scholarship based on your highest degree GPA. Once you are admitted to an ASU graduate program, you will automatically be considered. No application is necessary.
General ScholarshipsWe offer over 600 different types of scholarships. You can apply for both our general scholarships and degree-specific scholarships with one application.
With the ongoing shortage of nurses nationwide, nurse educators are in great demand throughout Texas and the U.S.
As soon as you graduate, you will be eligible to start teaching nursing at community colleges, universities and nursing schools, and in a variety of healthcare settings.

Our M.S.N. - Nurse Educator is an online advanced nursing degree designed to accommodate your busy schedule. Your clinical requirements can usually be completed in your city of residence in Texas. Our staff are here to help you set up your clinical and education practicums at a healthcare facility near you.

While this is an online program, you will still be invited to join our Student Nurses Association. Membership will foster additional networking opportunities with healthcare professionals, as well as a stronger connection to your fellow nursing students and the ASU Ram Family.

Over the last several years, our online M.S.N. - Nurse Educator program has earned top national rankings for quality and affordability from respected publications like Fortune Magazine, as well as multiple online higher education guides, including NursingProcess.org and TopEducationDegrees.org. ASU has long been recognized as one of the top online master’s in nursing education schools in Texas.
Contact our program advisor

Whether you’re pursuing a master’s degree, doctoral degree or certificate/certification, you have access to all the services in ourCollege of Graduate Studies and Research. You’ll find information and resources for everything from registering for classes and writing a thesis – to available graduate/teaching assistantships and graduate research opportunities.
If you want to go fast, go alone. But if you want to go far, go together.
ApplyVisit UsRequest Info

“The simulation labs in the Health and Human Services Building have really helped. The mannequins are awesome—they can do everything. You go in there, you’re thrown into a situation, and things change. It’s really good critical-thinking training, to see where you lack, and where your strong points are.”

Beatrice Perez, Class of 2019, Nursing

“My nursing degree launched me on this journey, and that education has made everything else possible.”

Tracie Watkins, CEO, Shannon Rehabilitation Hospital, San Angelo | Classes of 2002 and 2020

“My favorite class was Anatomy my freshman year. This was my first glimpse into what my future would look like. That class created an experience that allowed me to discover my strengths and weakness and work on becoming a successful student.”

Alexis Samora, Class of 2022, Nursing
